intro: Erigeron latus, commonly known as the broadleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale purple. Erigeron latus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
